ovdesc.p: This application holds the results of a rebalancing request made in AM.COMPARE.
This application shares its layout with AM.COMPARE, there not all fields are truely meaningful.
This application provides deals of the selection for a particular portfolio and compares the
holdings of the portfolio against the strategy contained in the investment program.

desc.p: A link to the scenario generated during the rebalancing session before any orders have been generated.
The portfolio being processed in this request. Taken from the AM.COMPARE.DETAILS key.
A link to the AM.SCENARIO record found in this modelling session.
The T24 user that processed the request. This will be defined in the TSA.SERVICE record.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Is rebalancing of BUY positions required.
The number of orders generated during the rebalancing session for this portfolio.
Details and processing errors encountered during the rebalancing session.
Flag controlling whether a manual selected is required or not.
Taken from the AM.SCENARIO record.
Accepts a valid code from AM.REASON.TYPE application.
The short description of AM.REASON.TYPE is the encryption for this field.
Validation Rules:
Updated during the compare process.
Holds the number of cells in the model that has an overdraft detected for each portfolio.
Validation Rules:
Contains the number of cellular that are outbound in each grid of a compare process.
Validation Rules:
A free text field detailing the type of order generated.
The portfolio ID of the poftolio being processed.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Always "YES"
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The AM.COMPARE key.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The matrix that has been "forced" on this portfolio overiding its default from the investment program.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The date of the last comparison to take place for this portfolio and rebalancing request.
The key to the AM.GRID file holding the comparison information.
This field contains the number of cellular that are outbound in each grids of a compare process.
Stores the group id to which the portfolio belongs.
Associated multi-valued field along with fields starting from the field SAM.CODE till the SCENARIO field.
Validation Rules:

p.p: Specifies the type of process to compare and rebalance portfolio.
Accepts the values ‘RAISE CASH’ in addition to SECURITY, CURRENCY and HEDGING.
When FILE.NAME is AM.GROUP.PORT, this field allows only ‘RAISE CASH’ and ‘SECURITY’

desc.p: Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Records if open orders have been included in the valuation for this portfolio.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Details if the rebalancing session took place using an online high-volume service or during the Close of business.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
A breif description of the rebalancing request taken from the AM.COMPARE record.

p.p: Instruction button: Used to process a consolidate comparison of portfolios. Need to set a matrix and a currency.

desc.p: The date which the rebalancing engine processed this portfolio
Always "1"
A free-text list of the operations carried out during the processing of the portfolio in the rebalancing request.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Have the scenarios been cleared for this portfolio.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE. See AM.COMPARE for details.
Stores the group grid id.
Associated multi-valued field along with the fields starting from SAM.CODE till the field SCENARIO.
Validation Rules:
Any messages from the rebalancing engine.
A list of the scenarios found for this portfolio and modelling session.
Specifies the time at which the rebalancing engine completes its work.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE. See AM.COMPARE for details.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Has constraints checking on all orders generated been requested
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Has order generation from the scenarios proposed been requested.

p.p: Holds a portfolio whose security position is sold in order to raise cash.
When Rebalance level is GROUP, the portfolio must be a part of the rebalancing group.
When Rebalance level is Portfolio, the portfolio must be a part of the selection criteria.
Holds a value only when SESSION.TYPE is ‘RAISE CASH’

desc.p: Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
A unique rebalancing request id. Composed of the AM.COMPARE id and the PORTFOLIO being processing. Separated by a "/" character.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE. See AM.COMPARE for details.

p.p: Determines the amount of cash raised by selling the securities. The amount will be raised by selling out the most preferred sell securities.
Holds a value only when SESSION.TYPE is ‘RAISE CASH’

desc.p: Portfolios that were excluded from this comparison.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE. See AM.COMPARE for details.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Did the AXIS need rebuilding for this modelling session.
Accepts any one of the following values SEC.ACC.MASTER or AM.GROUP.PORT.
Validation Rules:
Holds the average of differences from various cellular of each grid that belongs to a compare process.
Validation Rules:
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The CCY involved in comparison consolidation.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.

p.p: Creates a shadow model(Copy of a model prefixed with 'S-' ) based on the matrix specified in the INVESTMENT.PROGRAM.
Accepts the values YES, NO and NULL.
If the value is "Yes" then it creates the shadow model based on the matrix specified in the INVESTMENT.PROGRAM
If the value is "No" then it uses the matrix specified in the MATRIX field.

desc.p: Defaulted from AM.COMPARE. See AM.COMPARE for details.
Determines why rebalancing is performed.
Accepts a description that is deflated in AM.SCENARIO.
Validation Rules:
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Instruction button: used to process a filter on proposed orders
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The axis that was used in the axis rebuild process.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The no. days worh of projected cash added to the portfolio valuation during rebalancing.
Updated during the compare processing, this multi-valued field contains the number of cells in the
model that have an overdraft detected for each portfolio.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE. See AM.COMPARE for details.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Has the comparison process being requested for this portfolio.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Is rebalancing of SELL positions required.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
The alternate price set to be used for this rebalancing session.
Defaulted from AM.COMPARE.
Was the portfolio valuation updated "Online" during the rebalancing request.
Valid rounding types are UP, DOWN and CLOSER
Defaults from AM.COMPARE.
The AM.COMPARE id is taken from the COMPARE.CODE
This field contains the average of the difference coming from the different cellular of each
grids belonging to a compare process.

p.p: Accepts a valid currency for raising cash.
Holds a value only when SESSION.TYPE is ‘RAISE CASH’
A valid AM.CRITERIA record to use a pre-defined selection configuration.
Accepts criteria record with file name as ‘AM.GROUP.PORT’ and ‘ACCOUNT’
The criteria entered depends on REBALANCE.LEVEL field.
